Mathematics.title: What is Addition?
Mathematics.content: Addition is like putting groups of things together to see how many you have in total. When you add 2 apples and 3 apples, you get 5 apples!

Mathematics.title: The Plus Sign
Mathematics.content: We use a special sign for addition, it looks like this: +. It's called the plus sign! So, 2 + 3 = 5.

Mathematics.title: Let's Practice!
Mathematics.content: You're ready to test your skills. Remember to count carefully. You've got this!

Science.title: The Animal Kingdom
Science.content: The world is full of amazing animals! Some live on land, some in the sea, and some can fly in the sky.

Science.title: What is a Mammal?
Science.content: Mammals are animals that have fur or hair and drink milk when they are babies. Lions, dogs, and even you are mammals!

Art.title: Primary Colors
Art.content: The three primary colors are Red, Yellow, and Blue. They are special because you can mix them to create all other colors!

Art.title: Mixing Colors
Art.content: If you mix Red and Yellow, you get Orange. If you mix Yellow and Blue, you get Green. What happens when you mix Red and Blue? You get Purple!

History.title: Dinosaurs!
History.content: Long, long ago, before people existed, giant reptiles called dinosaurs roamed the Earth. The T-Rex was a mighty hunter!

History.title: Ancient Egypt
History.content: The Ancient Egyptians built huge pyramids as tombs for their kings, called Pharaohs. They also wrote using cool pictures called hieroglyphs.

Music.title: What is Rhythm?
Music.content: Rhythm is the beat of the music! It's what makes you want to tap your feet or clap your hands. Every song has a rhythm.

Music.title: Instrument Families
Music.content: Instruments can be in families! String instruments like guitars, wind instruments like flutes, and percussion instruments like drums all make music in different ways.

Geography.title: Our Planet Earth
Geography.content: We live on a beautiful planet called Earth. It's mostly covered in water, which is why it's called the 'Blue Planet'.

Geography.title: Continents and Oceans
Geography.content: The big land areas on Earth are called continents, and the huge bodies of water are called oceans. There are 7 continents and 5 oceans to explore!
